summary:
Jean is a senior SAP consultant with over 24 years of working experience of which more than 20 years exclusively with SAP. He has in depth knowledge of SAP R/3 core modules MM, PP, QM, WM, inclusive interfacing with Manufacturing Execution Systems. He gathered this experience in the time he was SAP application consultant at DSM and KPN and SAP business consultant for Pyramid. Last 10 years he has acquired in depth knowledge of BI and APO. The advantage of this broad knowledge is that he can cover more roles and has knowledge about the integration of the ECC Modules, BI and SCM-APO. 
Jean is an enthusiastic person with good, open communication skills who is able to adapt himself to the organization and the environment he is working in. He is a good team player with a high sense of responsibility and especially likes sharing his knowledge with other team members and users. He is focused on results with a no-nonsense attitude. He always seeks for robust and simplified solutions. His long record of service for DSM/SABIC proves his dedication to his client.

projects.title: Agrifirm plant – Grain intake
projects.description: The legacy system to register and receipt, store, sale and invoice the grain transactions has to be replaced by SAP ECC implementation. Via an interface with UNIWIN system, the receipts, stock transfers and issues are transferred to the SAP ERP system. In SAP the invoicing is done. Typical for the business is the variety of purchase options. Jean is part time involved in this project as functional specialist in the area MM-Purchasing, MM-Invoicing, PP.

projects.title: SABIC Port Logistic Facility
projects.description: The PLF is a logistic facility to handle and prepare solid products for oversee-shipments. Palletized product is transferred from production plants to the facility. At the facility containers are filled and shipped to ports. The system landscape contains a container management system (NAVIS), SAP EWM, SAP ERP, SAP APO/G-ATP. Jean is involved in this project for impact of PLF on ERP/APO and modeling the empty container handling and planning.

projects.title: SABIC Europe continuous improvement
projects.description: During this period Jean was active within ICT ERP Transform department and realized several change requests like automated transfer of quality data via electronic certificate exchange, introduction of flexible storage solution concept (MRP area’s and storage locations) for container stacks and remote storage facilities, improving MPS planning by enhanced distribution of independent requirements, improving communication between sales and planning by automated product allocation request, and several other changes.

projects.title: SABIC EMDAD Europe project
projects.description: For global planning and reporting the SABIC Europe BI/SCM system needed to be connected with corporate BI and SCM systems. Phase II was meant for input data for Manufacturing KPI's and operational/tactical planning. Jean was responsible for functional and technical realization for Europe part of the interface. Especially the modeling of complex material flows for chemical plants to provide input for manufacturing KPI's is a major achievement. With his combined knowledge of BI, SCM and business, Jean could cover complete scope of project containing BI modeling, reporting and integrated planning.

contributors.headline: Project Manager Business Consultant SAP SCM & Production
Head of IT for CS at ASML
Senior SAP-consultant at Sumitomo Bakelite Europe, owner at ROWILO IT Consulting.

projects.title: SABIC Europe - License Secrecy project
projects.description: For one of its polymer plants SABIC Europe uses an externally owned license. Part of the license agreement is that technology critical data are protected against unauthorized use. For SAP ERP system this means that access to recipe data and derivations of recipes has to be limited to a few authorized employees, and shielded from others. After failed go live in 2008, Jean was involved in Dec. 2009 to successfully implement an adequate authorization concept with standard SAP authorization objects supplemented with technical enhancements and continuous monitoring procedures.

projects.title: SABIC Europe - Minerva, implementation of new, highly automated compounding plant
projects.description: SABIC Europe has built a brand new compounding plant in Genk , (B), for its Polypropylene Compounding activities. Process control, manufacturing execution and enterprise recourse planning have been highly integrated at this site. Jean was responsible for realization of ERP and Manufacturing Execution integration. Existing and new defined interfaces for production orders, quality results, stock data, inclusive silo stock management, and production realizations and confirmations have been used. Proven Idoc based technology, as well as SOA service concepts, have been implemented. Furthermore, Jean was responsible for implementing integrated planning of upstream base polymer sites at Geleen and Gelsenkirchen and downstream compounding activities at Genk.

projects.title: SABIC Europe - Prospect To Order
projects.description: SABIC Europe has launched this project to improve the process of capturing potential new business and integrate these data into existing planning and budget figures. In this project Jean was responsible for the integration of PTO data into existing Demand Plan.

projects.title: SABIC Europe - Diamond
projects.description:
To support SABIC’s ambitious growth strategy a comprehensive continuous improvement track has been started in 2006. It started with a detailed analysis of processes and (future) bottlenecks to come up with improvements and project proposals. During this analysis the SCOR model was used. Jean participated in the PLAN and MAKE team as ICT process expert. Thereby he was responsible for ARIS process models of the PLAN and MAKE processes.
One of the improvements of the Diamond project was the transfer of the Demand Planning process from R/3 flexible planning in LIS to SCM APO Demand Planning. After that the Sales & Operations Planning has been depicted in APO-DP module. In these projects Jean was responsible for the design and realization of the APO DP planning object structures, planning areas, planning books as well as the BI info providers, info objects, update rules and data extractions needed for the planning processes.

profile_positions.description: Since April 2015 employed at Qrcus, providing SAP logistics consultancy services for different customers. Currently fulfilling SAP consultancy services for Medtronic.
